dialogs.text: A phrasal verb to mean that you use up all of something and no longer have any more of it.
dialogs.answer:
To run out of something
Example: I am heading to the market because I ran out of coffee this morning.

dialogs.text: To have a powerful want or desire for something.
dialogs.answer:
To crave something
Example: My mom said that she had been craving tacos all week.

dialogs.text: When you write out many things like names or groceries to get so that you don't forget them.
dialogs.answer:
To make a list
Example: The bride-to-be made a long guest list, and now we are helping write out the invitations to everyone.

dialogs.text: To not do or see something for an extended period of time.
dialogs.answer:
Been so long since the last time/Been so long since
Example: It has been so long since the last time he visited his relatives. I'm sure they miss him.

dialogs.text: Why is this fish called a snakehead fish?
dialogs.answer:
because the head of it looks like a snake's
Example: Snakehead fish is a type of freshwater fish and native to Asia and Africa.

dialogs.text: A food group that comes from plants, similar to fruits.
dialogs.answer:
Vegetables
Example: Specialists say you should have 5 servings of vegetables daily.

dialogs.text: The act of going out to purchase food to eat.
dialogs.answer:
Grocery shopping
Example: Many people usually hate grocery shopping when the store is packed with many people.

dialogs.text: Foods or things that you use to create a particular dish.
dialogs.answer:
Ingredients
Example: Popular recipes among busy parents are 5 ingredient main dishes that are quick to cook.

dialogs.text: A plant that is used to add both a flavor and aromatic elements to a dish.
dialogs.answer:
Herb

Example: Rice patty is a type of herb.

dialogs.text: A type of powder used in sour soup to give it a sour taste.
dialogs.answer:
Tamarind powder
Example: The tamarind powder is the main ingredient that makes the soup sour.

dialogs.text: A type of herb that thrives in flooded rice fields.
dialogs.answer:
Rice paddy herb
Example: I find rice paddy herbs are very aromatic and give many dishes that amazing smell.

dialogs.text: A long and slender herb that has jagged edges.
dialogs.answer:
Saw Tooth herb
Example: Saw tooth herbs are a great add to many soup dishes.

dialogs.text: A fresh leaf herb that you typically add to a dish right before serving.
dialogs.answer:
Cilantro
Example: I was surprised to find out that some people hate cilantro because they think it tastes like soap.

dialogs.text: A comparative that means better or intensified flavor.
dialogs.answer:
More flavorful
Example: The soup will be more flavorful if you add it with a dipping sauce.

dialogs.text: Something that the people in the south of Vietnam add to the sour soup dish to make it sweeter in place of sugar.
dialogs.answer:
Pineapple
Example: Pineapples are a citric fruit that commonly grows in Latin America and Africa.

dialogs.text: To like something better than others, or you choose it more than the rest.
dialogs.answer:
To prefer something
Example: I prefer squeezing in a bit of lime to add flavor to my dipping sauce.

dialogs.text: To cut a few pieces or bits of something from a larger portion.
dialogs.answer:
Some slices of something
Example: Adding some slices of green onions to your noodles will make them taste even better.

dialogs.text: A phrase that is similar to rather than and means in place of.
dialogs.answer:
Instead of something
Example: Instead of going to the mall today, we should go to the park.

dialogs.text: A tropical vegetable that is also known as "water spinach"
dialogs.answer:
Water morning glory
Example: Many people add steamed water morning glory into their pho.

dialogs.text: A soup-based dish that is left simmering or boiling on the table, and the diners can add ingredients to cook and then eat.
dialogs.answer:
Hot pot
Example: Hot pot is excellent to eat during many celebrations or get-togethers.

dialogs.text: A condiment or thing that comes on the side of a dish to add extra flavor.
dialogs.answer:
Dipping sauce
Example: Fish sauce with chili and lime makes for a great dipping sauce when eating pork hocks.

dialogs.text: A statement used to say that you think something is true, but you are a bit unsure.
dialogs.answer:
As far as I know
Example: As far as I know, she still wants to buy the tickets to visit her family even though they are pretty expensive.

dialogs.text: A spicy red thing that is catagorized as a hot pepper.
dialogs.answer:
Red chili
Example: Unless you can handle spicy things, you shouldn't add in too much red chili.

dialogs.text: A round and green citrus fruit.
dialogs.answer:
Lime
Example: You should know that limes and lemons are distinctively different.

dialogs.text: This phrase is used to emphasize how much you want to eat something.
dialogs.answer:
My mouth is watering
Example: My mouth was watering as I watched him eat my favorite dish.
